conclusion: Analyze forces to determine pressure exerted by sled on ground.
Identify forces acting on the system.
Weight of the child is 300 N.
Weight of the sled is 100 N.
Total weight of the system is 400 N.
Pulling force is applied at an angle 37Â° above horizontal.
Horizontal component of pulling force is 80 N.
Vertical component of pulling force is 60 N.
Determine normal force exerted by ground.
Normal force balances vertical forces acting on system.
Vertical forces include total weight and vertical component of pulling force.
Net vertical force must be zero for constant speed.
Normal force N is calculated as 340 N.
Magnitude of pressure exerted by sled equals normal force.
